intro: Antilla alpestris, commonly known as the alpine antilla, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
